content: tried it with this pattern to confirm instructions we ll start with the head working in the main color r1 single_crochet 9 in a magic_ring and pull it tight slip_stitch to join to the 1st single_crochet *place a stitch marker in the back loop of the 1st single_crochet of this round 9 single_crochet note if you re left with a small hole in the middle of the magic_ring close it when you re securing yarn tails in the next few row just sew a couple stitches across it on the inside wrong side of the tardigrade now we re going to make the mouth r2 chain 1 working in the front loop only half_double_crochet in every stitch around and join with a slip_stitch to the 1st half_double_crochet 9 half_double_crochet cut the yarn and fasten_off at this point for round 3 start again using a new length of yarn same color to make the rest of the body attach that new yarn to the stitch that was marked in round 1 r3 ch1 working in the back loops of round 1 increase in the marked stitch and in every stitch around 18 single_crochet **at the end of this round and every round join with a slip_stitch to the first stitch of that round then chain 1 ** the hard part is over the rest of the tardigrade will be worked in both loops the construction method is explained in detail in the notes above but here are some particular tips to remember as you go  at the end of every round join with a slip_stitch and then chain 1 for clarity i won t repeat that instruction again but it applies to every round  the slip_stitch and chain 1 don t count toward the stitch count for a round  never crochet in the previous round s slip_stitch  make the sl stitches very tight to avoid holes at the join  consider using the invisible decrease method  seeing your own stitches can be tricky when using fuzzy blanket yarn so i found it helpful to use a stitch marker to mark the first single_crochet of every round that marker will indicate where the slip_stitch goes and where after chaining 1 the first stitch of the next round will go r4 increase 2 single_crochet around 24 single_crochet r5 3 single_crochet increase around 30 r6 single_crochet increase 3 single_crochet around 36 r7 single_crochet around 36 r8 single_crochet around 36 r9 single_crochet decrease around 24 r10 increase single_crochet around 36 single_crochet r11 5 single_crochet increase around 42 r12 single_crochet around 42 r13 single_crochet around 42 r14 single_crochet around 42 r15 single_crochet decrease around 28 r16 increase single_crochet around 42 r17-20 single_crochet around 42 4 rounds r21-32 repeat rounds 15-20 two more times 12 rounds *don t fasten_off now it will look like a head followed by 4 bumps find the long curving trace of the slip_stitch joins down the length of the tardigrade this will be on the bottom underneath
